intro: Viguiera fabrisii, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well-suited for arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pink, attracting various pollinators. Viguiera fabrisii is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
